caption: I catered them for my sons party. Wow food was amazing. Everyone enjoyed the food. Had a very big order and they made sure I had plenty of plates and silverware. I will not be using anyone else for my kids parties. Thank you so much for making our special day even more special.
Food and service is amazing

I placed an order on my grandsons birthday. It took them 2 hours to deliver our food. When I called them some gentlemen answered the phone all he did was laugh and hang up the phone twice. Very Rude. No Respect for his customer. I called the second time to report the pizza was cold and he laughed again and hung up the phone. It was a very bad experience for me considering it was the first time I ordered from Rosati's Certainly it will be my last. Also I was Over Charged. Owner seem not to care. Didnt even Reply. Only to positive feedback. Lol!
Excellent... Always fresh... Worth the wait

Ate at this pizza joint since the grand opening in the end of Spring 2020. The prices can tank your wallet if you aren't wary, but the quality almost makes up for it. Sure, there's tons of other pizza places with more affordable pizzas. But when it's your hunger and taste buds at stake, it's a risk with it's reward. Also the staff is totally super cool. With their late hours and nice menu (I've tried almost everything so far), it's a pizza fanatic, night owl, logan dweller's bestest amigo. Always my go-to whenever I'm ever in the area and when my stomach speaks over my thoughts.

I went for pick up, they didn’t do my order, and they asked me to be back in 25 mins, I went back after 30 mins, the lady there was screaming on me and said, we don’t have the order yet and you need to wait 15 mins more. This is my Last time visiting this store.
I prefer the pizza from Rosatis in Waukesha, Wisconsin but it's good enough to get rid of the cravings.

The food is amazing and the staff are great. When it’s late and everything is closed I go to Rosati’s to get pizza. The price is a little high for the slices and I don’t usually mind, but when the quality doesn’t meat the value it is disappointing. The pizza is good, but I believe they can do better. The pizza always has a different flavor every time I go there; sometimes the pizza is 10/10 good sometimes meh. I really think they’ll do better if they focus on their pizza recipe. I personally believe it’s the sauce that makes this pizza vary from good to bad.
Wonderful Cashier.

Ordered today, ordered at 5:42 PM and after 8 PHONE CALLS WHICH NOBODY ANSWERED. Finally spoke with someone and they said driver on way. DRIVER SHOWS UP AT 8:30 PM, WORSE PART, IM A BLOCK AWAY FROM THE ESTABLISHMENT. THIS IS NOT ONLY PATHETIC AND DIDNT GET MY ORDER, THEY LEFT ME STARVING. LAST TIME I ORDER FROM THIS  PLACE. PERIOD
Rosati's think crust pizza is the best. Italian beef with Jardinera Sausage with mushrooms Or just a pepperoni pizza are the best.
Our order was done in the time frame the gave me and the pizza was good. Classic rosatis!

Very friendly staff and the right Rosati’s experience! I will be coming back here for sure and the deals are always worth going for here. Always a good walk here and they are right on time with when the pizzas will be done. Great thin crust every time.
Very good food.

It’s been twice since my bf and I ordered from this location, and we wanted to give this specific spot a second chance. We ordered a sausage and pepperoni pizza. Well, we go it delivered twice and in both times it arrives cold! We are not even too far from this location. This place doesn’t compare to the Lombard location and the one by Thatcher and Grand. Disappointed. Not ordering again...lesson learned!

I ordered from this location for the first time tonight for my daughter's birthday. I ordered an 18" pizza, 6 wings and fries. I received, an hour later, a cold pizza and 2 orders of wings(no fries). We called the restaurant to voice our complaints and not only was the manager Kim polite, apologetic, and understanding but she sent over a brand new fresh HOT pizza AND a piece of cake with the words happy birthday on the bag. I am beyond touched by the whole Rosati's team. The pizza was great the second time around and we will definitely be ordering again.
Mmmmm good
I walk by here all the time and see cooks and cashiers with their masks off.
Looks really good and staff is veryyy nice! Shout out to Kim!

the staff was friendly. the pizza slice was horrible. I could purchase a better cruse from a grocery store. why anyone would buy pizza from there when the boiler room is literally right next door is beyond me. I'm pretty sure that putting a pizza shop right next to the boiler room is about as insulting as a company could be. that's not competition that's trying to steal business from a well-established Chicago eatery. the slice that I purchased was pitiful. I seriously didn't throw the crust to my dog.

Love the friendly staff every time I’ve called and their willingness to look up my last order for me to order it again. We always get the White Pizza and Cheese Pizza. Also I love that they have the vegetarian pizza slice option on Friday and it’s not cooked as a half veggie pizza half meat pizza.

How difficult could it possibly be?  I ordered a salad. Chicken Caesar salad. It comes with 1 cup of dressing. I proceeded to ask for an extra cup. I was charged for it. No big deal. That’s fine. My issue is, when it arrived at my home, BOTH cups of dressing were missing. How does THAT happen? You order a salad and it comes with dressing. You ask for extra and none arrive? Unacceptable. I then proceed to call the restaurant and I’m told it would be an hour before the dressing would arrive. How is THAT acceptable? They are only a 10 minute drive away from my home and I have to wait an hour for THEIR mistake? That is unfair and unacceptable. Needless to say, I will be making a chargeback on my credit card. I did not receive the entirety of my order or the extra that I paid for. On top of all of that, there was NO attempt to rectify the situation for me. The person on the phone sounded like he didn’t know what to do.

Gave us the wrong size deep dish but charged us for the bigger one and it wasn’t even that good. When the manager called us back and left a message she sounded like she was being inconvenienced because we wanted a refund for the difference so we’re not even gonna deal with her or eat at another rosatis again. Get better management in there
Pizza by the slice 🔥🔥🔥

Restaurant is okay but could be better. I expected to go in and be greeted like any other paying customer walking into a establishment like this but I was greeted with the opposite. I stood and waited for my order to be taken for a good 15 minutes before a dark haired young lady even came from the back joking around and playing on her phone. She looked up from her phone to acknowledge I was there but still processed to make me wait another 2 minutes or so before she took my order. She asked me in a very demanding tone what I wanted and even after taking my order she started talking to the cooks rudely as well. I was there to experience one cook ask her a question and she rudely told him to stop asking her questions. I work in customer service myself and I would never 1. Be rude and disrespectful to a paying customer 2. Make a customer wait so I can play on my phone and 3. Treat my co worker’s with disrespect when they clearly need my help. I sat at a table and waited for my order as she just stood in the back twirling her hair and not Bothering to answer the phone when it rang or help the cook in the back who seemed to be struggling and backed up. I’ve been to one other rosati’s location in the city and I can promise you the employees were not this rude and unprofessional. The food is good but I rather go to the other location where I know I will be treated kindly and my food isn’t going to drag because some employees don’t want to help out their coworkers.

Love the location of the store, hours are great for people like me who get out of work late and don’t feel like cooking at such late hours. I was disappointed in the customer service though. The female employees I’ve noticed have a habit of of touching and playing with their hair then handling food which is extremely unsanitary. On the particular occasion that I came in the store the blondlish female employee was very rude. Just over all didn’t seem like she wanted to be there, her tone was very dry and snarky and she was also speaking to her other coworkers like that who were trying to help her with orders. She was constantly running her hands through her hair or braiding sections of hair then touching the food containers with hair strands visibly falling off her hands onto her shirt and the counter. This honestly made me very paranoid eating my food thinking that I would definitely find hair in it. Luckily there was no hair in my food but a few long strands outside the box. If employees can’t tie their hair up or at least have the decency not to constantly play with there hair and leave strains all over the place they should not be handling food. That is just gross and not what I’m paying for. I don’t know if the ladies are doing this out of boredom or if they just don’t care about customer service but this should be handed by management right away, no one wants to pay $40 bucks for food just to have it ruined by finding someone else’s hair in it. I’ve noticed other reviews about management at this location as well and I would have to agree with them. The staff should be held to a higher standard than this and as of right now it seems like management has no standards for how employees should behave with customers and other co workers. I think they need to take a long hard look at the people employed at this store because some do not need to be working In an environment where they are expected to treat customers and Colleagues with respect and are failing to do so.
Great service, enjoyed the atmosphere. Kim was very nice!
I was waiting over 20 min for my sandwich. They are so slow with few orders only.

Store is run very unprofessional by management. I love Rosati’s and I’ve been eating food from this restaurant for years, but this particular location needs new management. She is never anywhere to be found when there’s a problem with an order, she doesn’t enforce masking wearing for all her employees because I’ve gone in mutiple times and seen workers without mask on and in my opinion the lack of leadership shows through the food because I’ve been in twice now and the cooks are backed up on orders and it takes forever to get something simple and still no sign of Management for help. This is a new location but management is lacking the knowledge it takes to run that store Properly. The food is good but it wasn’t anything spectacular or worth waiting an hour for due to lack of leadership and a short staff.
I mean look, it's drunk pizza food. It's a little overpriced especially for the quality, but it serves its purpose.
Very mediocre and low-key expensive for a single slice
Was waiting for my food over 45 min...2 slices of pizza

AMAZING! I ordered pizza and wings last night. The customer service was great and the food was delicious 😋 Honestly logan square has been needing a great late night pizzeria! 🍕🍕 Thank you so much will be ordering again 🙏🏼
Their Italian beef is so good!!!

Will start off saying this - ordered the windy city, and it was delicious. Crust was warm and crispy, didn't skimp on toppings, wasn't too oily. Unfortunately, that's where the positives end. Ordered cheesy garlic bread, but got bread with some kind of garlic spread that covered a pretty small area of the bread, no cheese. I've had the cheesy garlic bread before, this is not it. Pretty frustrating to not get what you paid for.  I ordered online, and said the pizza should be ready in 25-35 minutes. I show up at the 30 minute mark, and notice there are a couple customers just waiting around. One of them actually just leaves, clearly frustrated. After about 5 minutes of just silence, someone finally comes out from the back, takes my payment, says it'll be another 5-8 minutes. It ended up being another 20 minutes. I'm not super upset about that aspect, it's Logan Square, they may have gotten behind because of the dinner rush, who knows. What DID frustrate me was that one of the people I thought was a customer, was actually an employee! He was just out front, blaring music/watching videos completely ignoring us, and letting someone just walk out the front door!! This particular Rosati's is new, I get it, but wow! Just flat out ignorning customers really makes the screwed up order seem much worse, same with delay.

I'm revising my original review as it may have sounded too harsh.  That wasn't my intention.  Apologies to the owner.  The pizza at Rosati's is good.  They make a unique, quality thin crust pizza.  My go to is meatball, mushroom, and spinach.  I have not tried the double crust yet.  This pizza is great hot and fresh.  Unlike other pizza places, the crust isn't as good as cold leftovers.  There is a lot of pizza competition in the Logan Square area.  If you look at value+quality, I would prefer to go to other pizza shops.  Rosati's provides a coupon flier with a purchase.  This helps make a slightly overpriced, quality pie at a competitive and reasonable price.
Very nice workers food is awesome Order was made quick
Good size slices but too pricy . $5.50 for pep but $6.50 for pep and sausage .. service was good 1st time second time felt like i wasnt welcomed at all .. not worth goin back a 3rd
If you’re looking for a reliable tavern style pizza - this is your best bet. Reasonable prices and great service. Kim is a helpful, kind employee and would recommend!
Great food! Friendly staff and helpful! Delicious mango habanero wings!
My go to spot for pizza delivery..one of the best spots authentic flavor on everything from the sauce to the toppings shows up hot to your door worth every penney if i could give more stars i would
They have incredible customer service and very hygenic especially during Covid. Couldn't recommend them enough!

Logan Local Review:  I am so happy Logan Square finally got a Chicago pizza spot!!! They offer slices which is super convenient for a quick fix. The decor inside is super clean and all vintage Chicago Sports!! It has a modern/pub feel which I love! Very welcoming. The staff is super friendly too!! Would recommend to anyone in the mood for some zaaa!!!

I've edited my review to reflect my latest experience. After an initial poor experience which centered around employee training, not quality, the owner TJ reached out and spoke very honestly with me about the issue and demonstrated that it had been corrected.  The pizza and wings were great. The pizza is exactly what you would expect from a Chicago style thin crust and the wings had plenty of meat on the bone along with an abundance of sauce. This will definitely be a regular stop for my household.

Rosati's was recommended to me by a local as having one of the best pizzas in Chicago. I'll admit it was good, but wasn't mind blowing. Let me run it down for you.  Location is a nice place right underneath the blue line California stop, and so ease of access is a 5. Seemed like there was adequate street parking as well.  It had a good Aesthetic to it! It was nicely lit and decorated to the classic pizzeria theme. There were pizzas already out under a hot lamp that you can grab by the slice as well as a full menu to order from.  I got the sausage pizza slice and mt dew can to go. Total was $7. I liked the flavor of the seasonings and cheese, it was hot, tasted fresh and was overall a good meal. It's probably something that I'd go back for, but only because of the quick and easy meal factor.
Pizza wasn't very good. Its probably for the late night drunk crowd. The dough is terrible. Very thick and bland.

The pizza was good, and the wings were pretty good too... but neither really stood out that much - especially for the price. Great service and friendly people, but probably will revert to other pizza options.

Holy moly, this is the best thin crust pizza in Logan Square. I will admit that the food is slightly overpriced, I have to take a star off but damn, it's good. A welcomed addition to the neighborhood.
Ordered Rosati Monster Pizza yesterday and it was DELICIOUS! all those toppings of deliciousness! First time we ordered from this place and it won't be the last.
Exquisite features, fresh ingredients and beautiful sauce. Unlike most pizza places I’ve tried. What a tremendous experience; it will have you full and complete and settled. Will come back again!

Pizza is very delicious!! Would definitely return to get more. Constantly cleaning, atmosphere was great everyone was so nice, and quick service from cashiers. Thank you to my cashier Angelica she got my order out quick and very friendly
Sorry, I won’t pay $45 for a L pizza and 4 toppings; $2.50 add on per veggie? LOL WoW, time to open a reasonable pizza shop on Cali and Milwaukee!
